Mr Andy Coulson is by far the most significant scalp to emerge from the ongoing row over phone hacking. he had to resign. But the precedent is a bad one. As I wrote last September, when Keith Vaz , the Labour chairman of Commons home affairs select committee, was upping the ante, Andy Coulson 's antagonists seem to be forging a new and frankly preposterous politico-legal doctrine of executive responsibility: namely, that a man should not only lose the job he holds at the time of the wrongdoing, but all subsequent jobs. On this sinister basis, one strike and you are out- forever. Andy Coulson has now lost two very senior positions in less than four years without a single allegation against him having been proved. Politics- and Michael Government- will be poorer without him. But more honourable and
